treatment.description: Herbage glabrous or nearly so. Leaves: blades of proximal often abruptly contracted or at least obtuse at bases; mid and distal leaves clasping. Heads usually 6–12(–20). Phyllaries mostly 13, 6–8+ mm.
treatment.habitat: rocky, open sites in conifer-dominated areas
treatment.discussion: Plants of var. bigelovii from the north of the range tend to be intermediate with var. hallii.
